#Text=Aral
#Text=Aral
#Text=( Арал ) or Aralsk ( Аральск , formerly , and in Russian ) is a city in Kazakhstan .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Aral is a former fishing village located in Western Kazakhstan near the Aral Sea .
#Text=In 1920 , Soviet leader Vladimir Lenin asked the people of Aral to give fish to feed starving Russians , which they did .
#Text=The story is commemorated by a mural in the Aral train station .
#Text=Aral has suffered in recent years due to the retreating Aral Sea .
#Text=Many tourists come to Aral in order visit ship cemeteries , which , like the Aral Sea itself , are quickly disappearing .
#Text=Many locals use the metal from the abandoned ships to build fences and walls , and in many ship cemeteries all that is left are skeletons of ships .
#Text=Get in
#Text=The closest major city to Aral is Kyzylorda , which is about 12 hours away by train .
#Text=Trains leave from Astana and Almaty to Aral .
#Text=The train from Astana does not , however , stop in Almaty .
#Text=Trains from Astana to Aral will take about 2 days to reach their destination .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Aral is a very small city to walk around in ; there are taxis but they are basically unnecessary .
#Text=The train station is about a 15-minute walk from the main hotel .

#Text=There are two main streets : Makhataeva , on which you will find the hotel and Aral Tenizi office , and Abilhayir Han ( Абилхайыр хан ) , on which you can find some small shops and internet , this is also the road to follow north to get to the train station .
#Text=Абилхайыр хан used to be called Gorky and may still be called as such in some travel guides .
#Text=See
#Text=Aral does not have many attractions and most tourists are not interested in the town itself .
#Text=The old harbor is located just outside the hotel and it is possible to walk out to abandoned ships on the dry seabed from there .
#Text=Jeep tours can be booked , and in a half an hour you can reach a ship cemetery or the Aral Sea .
#Text=For information on sights and tours contact Aral Tenizi .
#Text=The Aral Tenizi office is located a few houses down from the hotel on 10-12 Makhataeva .
#Text=Do
#Text=Jeep tours can be arranged to various places along the Aral Sea , including various ship cemeteries .
#Text=Buy
#Text=There are very few shops in Aral .
#Text=A main market is housed west of the main square and past the train tracks .
#Text=Here you can find fresh fruit and vegetables .
#Text=Other smaller shops can be found near the center of town by the hotel .
#Text=These shops sell bread , jam , candy , soda , noodles , etc.
#Text=Eat
#Text=Aral does not offer much diversity in dining .
#Text=One restaurant is located across the street from the hotel and serves a variety of Kazakh dishes .
#Text=This is the largest restaurant in town and able to make a wide variety of dishes .
#Text=Other restaurants can be found around town ( many of them with the name Chin Son ) that offer less options , so be prepared to eat manty and shashlyk here .
#Text=All menus will be in Russian .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=There is one hotel in Aral , called simply " Aral " at 4 Makhateava St. It has two floors of rooms and one restaurant .
#Text=The rooms are quite simple and many have small tubs but no showers .
#Text=Expect to pay about 4,000 tenge per night .
#Text=Homestays are available and for this you should ask around .
#Text=If you do not speak Russian , try looking lost and asking for komnaty ( комнаты , " rooms " ) .
#Text=Go next
#Text=To leave Aral , buy tickets at the train station for your desired destination .
#Text=Be sure to include what class you would like to travel in .
#Text=Kupeyny is second class and has four berths and a closing door .
#Text=Third class has six berths and no doors , for a long train ride it is not the most comfortable but is good for meeting locals , who will most likely be very curious about you .
